column1: Pulmonary surfactant is a crucial substance in the lungs
It reduces the surface tension at the air-liquid interface in the alveoli
This reduction is essential for alveolar stability
Without surfactant, the alveoli would collapse after each exhalation
Surfactant improves lung compliance, making it easier to inflate the lungs
The presence of surfactant allows the lungs to expand and contract with less effort
Surfactant-deficient lungs experience decreased compliance, leading to respiratory distress
Thus, pulmonary surfactant plays a vital role in maintaining healthy lung function
